title: Andrew Jackson Barchfeld
text:
Andrew Jackson Barchfeld (May 18, 1863 – January 28, 1922) was a <a href="Republican%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Republican</a> member of the <a href="U.S.%20House%20of%20Representatives">United States House of Representatives</a> from <a href="Pennsylvania">Pennsylvania</a>.
Barchfeld was born in <a href="Pittsburgh%2C%20Pennsylvania">Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania</a>, to <a href="Germans">German</a> immigrants from <a href="Prussia">Prussia</a>. He attended <a href="Pittsburgh%20Central%20High%20School">Pittsburgh Central High School</a> and graduated from <a href="Jefferson%20Medical%20College">Jefferson Medical College</a> in <a href="Philadelphia%2C%20Pennsylvania">Philadelphia, Pennsylvania</a>, in 1884. He was a physician, hospital executive, and member of the common council of Pittsburgh from 1886 to 1887. He was a member of the Republican State committee. He was an unsuccessful candidate for election to Congress in 1902.
Barchfeld was elected as a Republican to the <a href="59th%20United%20States%20Congress">Fifty-ninth</a> and to the five succeeding Congresses. He was an unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1916. He was a delegate to the peace congress at <a href="Brussels">Brussels</a> in 1905. He was a member of the <a href="Taft%20Commission">commission</a> to the <a href="Philippine%20Islands">Philippine Islands</a> in 1910, and a member of the <a href="Panama%20Canal">Panama Canal</a> <a href="Isthmian%20Canal%20Commission">Commission</a> in 1912. 
Barchfeld died on January 28, 1922, in the <a href="Knickerbocker%20Theatre%20%28Washington%2C%20D.C.%29">collapse of the Knickerbocker Theater</a> in <a href="Washington%2C%20D.C.">Washington, D.C.</a> He is buried in South Side Cemetery in Pittsburgh.
